page.title: 12Friars Farm (1)
page.content: Recently a group of children from our school visited Friars Farm. The farm has been in the same family since it started 150 years ago. It was then a dairy farm with livestock - beef herd and chickens. The historical feature of the farm is the Brew House which is 200 years old. Today there is no livestock and most of the 400 acres are used for cereals -{Wheat: 160 {acres, Barley: 150 acres and Beans: 90 {acres.} These are winter crops and they do not grow any spring crops. The average field size is 25 acres and the soil is medium loam. They have two combine harvesters which are only used for 6 weeks of the year which seems a waste for such expensive machinery but they find it too difficult to hire them because of the high demand at harvest time.
